tit.cmt: ローマ字表記では本来「Shi」とするところですが、多くの解説で「Ci」となっていますので依拠しました

sen.j: 詞（し）とは中国における韻文形式の一つ、あるいは歌謡文芸の一つ。
sen.e: Ci is a form of Chinese poetry or an art form of ballad.
Ci is a form of Chinese poetry or an art form of ballad.
Ci is a form of Chinese poetry or an art form of ballad.

sen.j: 宋 (王朝)代に隆盛したので宋詞（そうし）ともいう。
sen.e: As it flourished in the Song Dynasty, it was called So Ci.
As it flourished in the Song Dynasty, it is called Soshi (Songci in Chinese).
sen.cmt: 日本語に合わせ現在形に変更しました。「宋詞」の訳を、「So Ci」（日本語読みと中国語読みが混ざっている）から、「Soshi (Songci in Chinese)」（日・中併記）に変更しました。
sen.e: As it flourished in the Song Dynasty, it is called Soshi (Songci in Chinese).

sen.j: 唐・五代では曲・雑曲・曲子詞（きょくしし）とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was also called Kyoku, Zakkyoku, or Kyokushi Ci in the Tang Dynasty and the Five Dynasties Period.
It was also called Kyoku, Zakkyoku, or Kyokushi Ci in the Tang Dynasty and the Five Dynasties Period.
It was also called Kyoku, Zakkyoku, or Kyokushi Ci in the Tang Dynasty and the Five Dynasties Period.

sen.j: また漢詩に対して詩余（しよ）とも言われ、長短不揃いの句で構成されることから長短句（ちょうたんく）ともいう。
sen.e: As contrasted with Kanshi (Chinese poems), it was called Shiyo as well; it was also known as Chotanku because it consisted of lines of irregular lengths, short and long.
As contrasted with Kanshi (Chinese poems), it is called Shiyo as well; it is also known as Chotanku because it consisted of lines of irregular lengths, short and long.
sen.cmt: 日本語に合わせ現在形に変更しました。
sen.e: As contrasted with Kanshi (Chinese poems), it is called Shiyo as well; it is also known as Chotanku because it consisted of lines of irregular lengths, short and long.

sen.j: 曲に合わせて詞が書かれたので、詞を埋めるという意味で填詞（てんし）、音楽に合わせるという意味で倚声（いせい）とも言われる。
sen.e: Since Ci was originally composed in accordance with music, it was sometimes called Ten Ci, meaning "filling the music with verses," and also Isei, meaning "to the tune of the music."
Since Ci was originally composed in accordance with music, it is sometimes called Ten Ci, meaning "filling the music with verses," and also Isei, meaning "to the tune of the music."
sen.cmt: 日本語に合わせ現在形に変更しました。
sen.e: Since Ci was originally composed in accordance with music, it is sometimes called Ten Ci, meaning "filling the music with verses," and also Isei, meaning "to the tune of the music."

sen.j: 日本語では漢詩（し）と同音であるため、区別しやすく中国語音からツーと呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: Since it had the same sound as the Japanese word "漢詩 Shi," it was also pronounced "Tsu" taken from the Chinese pronunciation to be distinguished from each other.
Since it has the same sound as the Japanese word "Kanshi (Shi)"(Chinese poems), it is also pronounced "Tsu" taken from the Chinese pronunciation to be distinguished from each other.
sen.cmt: 日本語に合わせ現在形に変更しました。
sen.e: Since it has the same sound as the Japanese word "Kanshi (Shi)"(Chinese poems), it is also pronounced "Tsu" taken from the Chinese pronunciation to be distinguished from each other.

sen.j: 後代には音楽に合わせて作られるのではなく、前人の作品の平仄に合わせて作られるようになったため、漢詩と同様、朗読される詩歌の一種となった。
sen.e: In later years, Ci was composed not to the music but to the tones of previous works, so it became regarded as a kind of recited verses like Chinese poems.
In later years, Ci was composed not to the music but to the tones of previous works, so it became regarded as a kind of recited verses like Chinese poems.
In later years, Ci was composed not to the music but to the tones of previous works, so it became regarded as a kind of recited verses like Chinese poems.

sen.j: 詞調に合わせて詞が作られるが、詞調ごとに形式が決められており、例えば「憶江南」では、句の字数が3・5・7・7・5、押韻が2・4・5句目と決められている。
sen.e: Ci was composed according to each tune that had the different form; for example, in "Okukonan 憶江南 (Recalling the south of the Chang Jiang River) " the number of characters in each line was determined by 3,5,7,7, and 5 characters, and the 2nd, 3rd, and 5th lines should be rhymed.
sen.cmt: 「詞調」とは音符の入った歌詞なしの楽譜のようなものだそうです
sen.e: Ci is composed according to each tune that had the different form; for example, in "Okukonan (Recalling the south of the Chang Jiang River) " the number of characters in each line is determined as 3,5,7,7, and 5 characters, and the 2nd, 4th, and 5th lines should be rhymed.
sen.cmt: 日本語に合わせ現在形に変更しました。「憶江南」を削除しました。「determined by」を 「determined as」に変更しました。「3rd」を「4th」に修正しました。
sen.e: Ci is composed according to each tune that had the different form; for example, in "Okukonan (Recalling the south of the Chang Jiang River) " the number of characters in each line is determined as 3,5,7,7, and 5 characters, and the 2nd, 4th, and 5th lines should be rhymed.

sen.j: 詞調には特定の名称が決められており、これを詞牌（しはい）という。
sen.e: A particular title called Ci-hai (label) was given to each tune.
A particular title called Ci-hai (label) is given to each tune.
sen.cmt: 日本語に合わせ現在形に変更しました。
sen.e: A particular title called Ci-hai (label) is given to each tune.

sen.j: 詞の題名には詞牌が使われており、詩のように内容による題はつけられない。
sen.e: Ci-hai used for the title of Ci had nothing to do with the contents unlike poems.
Ci-hai used for the title of Ci has nothing to do with the contents unlike poems.
sen.cmt: 日本語に合わせ現在形に変更しました。
sen.e: Ci-hai used for the title of Ci has nothing to do with the contents unlike poems.

sen.j: その代わり、詞牌の下に詞題が添えられたり、小序が作られた。
sen.e: Instead, a commentary indicating the contents was listed under Ci-hai, or a short preface was added.
Instead, a commentary indicating the contents was listed under Ci-hai, or a short preface was added.
Instead, a commentary indicating the contents was listed under Ci-hai, or a short preface was added.

sen.j: ただし、後代には内容による詞題が設けられることもあった。
sen.e: However, in later years, the title was given according to the contents.
However, in later years, the title was given according to the contents.
However, in later years, the title was given according to the contents.

sen.j: 詞牌の数は、清の康熙帝勅撰の『詞譜』によると、826調、同一詞牌で形式の異なる「同調異体」を数えると2306体に登る。
sen.e: According to "Ci-fu 詞譜" compiled by Emperor Kangxi in the Qing Dynasty, the number of Ci-hai amounts to 826 tunes, and it comes to as many as 2,306 including those with "a same tune but a different form."
sen.cmt: 「詞譜」の読み方がわかりませんでした
sen.e: According to "Ci-fu 詞譜" compiled by the Emperor Kangxi in the Qing Dynasty, the number of Ci-hai amounts to 826 tunes, and it comes to as many as 2,306 including those with "the same tune but a different form."
sen.cmt: 康熙帝：the Emperor Kangxi 「a same tuｎe」を「the same tune」に修正しました。
sen.e: According to "Ci-fu 詞譜" compiled by the Emperor Kangxi in the Qing Dynasty, the number of Ci-hai amounts to 826 tunes, and it comes to as many as 2,306 including those with "the same tune but a different form."

sen.j: このうち詞牌は100調くらいであったという。
sen.e: Chief among Ci-hai are roughly estimated at 100 tunes.
sen.cmt: 「このうち詞牌は・・・」の意味が、前段との関連でわかりにくく、詞牌を100巻にまとめた資料などがあった為、「おもな詞牌はざっと１００で」としました
sen.e: Chief among Ci-hai are roughly estimated at 100 tunes.
Chief among Ci-hai are roughly estimated at 100 tunes.

sen.j: 最も短いのは「竹枝」の14字、長いのは「鶯啼序」の240字である。
sen.e: The shortest Ci-hai named "Chikushi (Bamboo Branch Song)" consists of 14 characters, and the longest one named "Oteijo 鶯啼序," 240 characters.
sen.cmt: 「鶯啼序」の英訳タイトルが見つかりませんでした
sen.e: The shortest Ci-hai named "Chikushi (Bamboo Branch Song)" consists of 14 characters, and the longest one named "Oteijo 鶯啼序," 240 characters.
The shortest Ci-hai named "Chikushi (Bamboo Branch Song)" consists of 14 characters, and the longest one named "Oteijo 鶯啼序," 240 characters.

sen.j: 唐代、西域から新しい音楽（胡楽）が流入すると、従来の音楽体系が大きく変化した。
sen.e: When a new music (Kogaku) was introduced from the Western Regions in the Tang period, the conventional musical system greatly changed.
When a new music (Kogaku) was introduced from the Western Regions in the Tang period, the conventional musical system greatly changed.
When a new music (Kogaku) was introduced from the Western Regions in the Tang period, the conventional musical system greatly changed.

sen.j: このようにしてできた音楽に合わせて作られた歌詞が詞の由来である。
sen.e: Verses thus composed in accordance with music were the origin of Ci.
Verses thus composed in accordance with music were the origin of Ci.
Verses thus composed in accordance with music were the origin of Ci.

sen.j: その来源には宮中の燕楽や民間の通俗音楽にいたるいくつかがあると考えられる。
sen.e: Ci is considered to have various origins, from Engaku (Chinese court music) to popular music.
Ci is considered to have various origins, from Engaku (Chinese court music) to popular music.
Ci is considered to have various origins, from Engaku (Chinese court music) to popular music.

sen.j: 後代、曲や楽譜の伝承が途絶えると、その平仄や句式を基準にして作られた。
sen.e: In later years, after the tradition of those music and scores were lost, Ci was composed based on the tones or the form of each line.
In later years, after the tradition of those music and scores were lost, Ci was composed based on the tones or the form of each line.
In later years, after the tradition of those music and scores were lost, Ci was composed based on the tones or the form of each line.

sen.j: 詞の分類方法にはいくつかがある。
sen.e: There are several ways to classify Ci.
There are several ways to classify Ci.
There are several ways to classify Ci.

sen.j: 字数による分類によると、
sen.e: When classified by the number of characters, it goes as follows:
When classified by the number of characters, it goes as follows:
When classified by the number of characters, it goes as follows:

sen.j: 小令
sen.e: Shorei
Shorei
Shorei

sen.j: - 60字ぐらいまでの短編
sen.e: a short piece within 60 characters
a short piece within 60 characters
a short piece within 60 characters

sen.j: - 61字ぐらいまでの短編
sen.e: a short piece within 61 characters
a short piece within 61 characters
a short piece within 61 characters

sen.j: - それ以上の長編
sen.e: a long piece more than that
a long piece more than the above
a long piece more than the above

sen.j: 宋初までは小令がほとんどであった。
sen.e: The majority were Shorei until the early Sung period.
The majority were Shorei until the early Sung period.
The majority were Shorei until the early Sung period.

sen.j: 後代、
sen.e: In later years:
In later years:
In later years:

sen.j: 小令
sen.e: Shorei
Shorei
Shorei

sen.j: - 58字以内
sen.e: within 58 characters
within 58 characters
within 58 characters

sen.j: 中調
sen.e: Chucho
Chucho
Chucho

sen.j: - 59字から90字
sen.e: from 59 to 90 characters
from 59 to 90 characters
from 59 to 90 characters

sen.j: 長調
sen.e: Chocho
Chocho
Chocho

sen.j: - 91字以上
sen.e: more than 91 characters
more than 91 characters
more than 91 characters

sen.j: という分類がされたが、何か根拠となるようなものがあるわけではなく、単なる分類の目安である。
sen.e: This classification has no specific basis, only as a guide.
This classification has no specific basis, but is used only as a guide.
sen.cmt: 文法的におかしいので、修正しました。
sen.e: This classification has no specific basis, but is used only as a guide.

sen.j: また段落の数により、
sen.e: When classified by the number of stanza, it goes as follows:
When classified by the number of stanza, it goes as follows:
When classified by the number of stanza, it goes as follows:

sen.j: 単調
sen.e: Tancho
Tancho
Tancho

sen.j: - 分段されない小令。
sen.e: undivided Shorei
undivided Shorei
undivided Shorei

sen.j: 「漁歌子」「搗練子」「調笑令」「如夢令」など。
sen.e: e.g.: "Gyokashi 漁歌子," "Torenshi 搗練子," "Choshorei 調笑令," and "Jomurei 如夢令."
sen.cmt: 英語のタイトルがわかりませんでした
sen.e: e.g.: "Gyokashi," "Torenshi," "Choshorei," and "Jomurei"
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記してあるので、とりあえず、漢字を消してみました。
sen.e: e.g.: "Gyokashi," "Torenshi," "Choshorei," and "Jomurei"

sen.j: 双調
sen.e: Socho
Socho
Socho

sen.j: - 上下2闋（ケツ、詞の段落）。
sen.e: with two stanzas
with two stanzas
with two stanzas

sen.j: 小令・中調・長調いずれもある。
sen.e: Shorei, Chucho, and Chocho are in this category.
Shorei, Chucho, and Chocho are in this category.
Shorei, Chucho, and Chocho are in this category.

sen.j: 「菩薩蛮」「西江月」「満江紅」「蝶恋花」など。
sen.e: e.g.: "Bosatsuban 菩薩蛮," "Seikogetsu 西江月," "Mankoku 満江紅," and "Chorenka 蝶恋花."
sen.cmt: 英語のタイトルがわかりませんでした 「満江紅」の読み方がわかりませんでした
